meanings.definition: In accordance with fact or reality
meanings.sent1: The sky was the truest blue I had ever seen.
meanings.sent2: Her truest friend always told her the truth.
meanings.sent3: The truest answer to the riddle was right in front of us.
meanings.sent4: His smile was the truest reflection of his happiness.
meanings.sent5: The truest measure of success is personal fulfillment.

meanings.sent1: The compass pointed north, providing the truest direction.
meanings.sent2: The truest way to test a theory is through experimentation.
meanings.sent3: The truest source of information turned out to be the old library books.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition was the truest guide in making important decisions.
meanings.sent5: The truest indicator of his skill was his consistent performance.

meanings.sent1: The dog remained by his side, his truest companion.
meanings.sent2: She was the truest supporter of his dreams.
meanings.sent3: The truest fans never missed a single game.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was the truest bond that could never be broken.
meanings.sent5: The truest love is unconditional and unwavering.
